It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring elongated, lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, which bloom during the late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical or subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
